Text: Grab Customers with Stasis Fields \n and Get Them to the Store
Ah, the Gravity Queen. \n Wonderful timing!
I have a job just for \n you.
More flyers?
No, no, this job's \n of a much more \n urgent nature.
I've procured a few too \n many ingredients...
I need your help selling \n my food before it all \n goes bad!

Bring me as many 
 customers as you can, 
 even if you have to drag 
 them here.
Not sure how happy those \n customers will be about \n that...

It's fine! Once they 
 taste my wares, they'll 
 be happy you dragged 
 them here.

Just between us, 
 it doesn't hurt that 
 a pretty lady will be 
 escorting them.
Well, when you \n put it that way... \n You've got it!
Time to start hauling people over!
Not enough customers yet...
Getting there...
Just a few more should do it.
Let me show you this great place!
There's a great store you've gotta see!
Right this way!
I've got a place you have to see!
Come one, come all!
Store Owner: \n People are coming from the station.
Bring me some \n downtown \n commuters.
We only serve the \n freshest products, so \n time is of the essence.
If I hear about a \n crowd somewhere, \n I'll call you.
Okay, I'll bring \n some people by.
Customers Needed
I need to gather up some customers for that store.
I brought you as many \n customers as I could...
You've done a fine job \n in such a short time!

I managed to sell out, 
 and gained a few happy 
 customers in the 
 bargain.
Thank you, Gravity \n Queen!
Here's a little \n something for your \n trouble...

And feel free to stop by 
 anytime, all the food 
 and drink you want is on 
 the house!
Really!? Wow!
I owe you big time.

Besides, I'm only 
 happy to do it given 
 all you've done for 
 the city.
Thank you!
Glad someone does see \n the good I'm doing!
I brought you as many \n customers as I could...
Thank you!
I lost a little to \n spoilage, but at least I \n finished in the black.
Here's a little \n something for your \n trouble...
And feel free to stop by \n sometime, it'll be my \n treat.
I will!
Now I'm glad I \n helped out!
I brought you as many \n customers as I could...

Well, I'll give you 
 that... But you sure 
 took your sweet time 
 doing it.
I lost over half my \n inventory to spoilage.

I guess it's better than 
 nothing, and I sold 
 enough to stay in 
 business...

Obviously I'm in no 
 shape to pay you, but 
 here's a half-off ticket 
 you can use sometime.
Ah... Thanks...

If I could've just been 
 a little faster, maybe I 
 could've scored a free 
 meal ticket.
